question: From which nation Burundi got its independence in 1962?
explanation: Burundi gained its independence from Belgium in 1962. From 1884 onwards, the German East Africa Company was trying all attempts to take control of the African Great Lakes region which found success in 1891 that made Burundi its colony. During World War II, Germany lost the territory to Belgium. As a result of the local revolts and rebellions from 1959, Burundi was freed of Belgian clutches in 1962.
